newsitem.title: USA: Economy doing well, inflation hasn't erupted - Rivlin.
newsitem.headline: Economy doing well, inflation hasn't erupted - Rivlin.

text.p: Federal Reserve Vice Chair Alice Rivlin said Tuesday that the U.S. economy is doing well and that inflation has not erupted.
"At the moment things look pretty good," Rivlin told an America's Community Bankers conference.
She said economic reports from around the country show that jobs are increasing, unemployment is low, and wages are rising gradually.
Rivlin said that inflation had not surfaced.
"The pace of growth does not seem frenetic in most places, and inflation has not yet reared its ugly head," Rivlin said. "It's a remarkably favorable set of circumstances."
She said the biggest threat to the economy would be "too much of a good thing" which would result in an overheated economy generating inflation.
